data.title: 10 Myths About Oracle Siebel Crm 2009
data.meta_description: 10 Myths About Oracle Siebel Crm 2009 - Download as a PDF or view online for free
data.text:
•Download as PPT, PDF•

3 likes•3,296 views

This document discusses Siebel CRM, including its history and common myths. It begins with definitions of CRM and the customer lifecycle. It then discusses Siebel CRM's origins and growth in the 1990s before being acquired by Oracle. The rest of the document addresses the top 10 myths of Siebel CRM, such as addressing concerns over customization, integration, usability and Siebel On-Demand. It aims to dispel misconceptions about the software.

10 Myths About Oracle Siebel Crm 2009

1. 10 Myths for Oracle Siebel CRM Станимира Накова [email_address] Борис Стефанов [email_address] ТехноЛогика Офис Дървеница Ул. Софийско Поле № 3 , София http:// www.technologica.com We make IT work for you!

2. CONTENT What is CRM? Siebel CRM History Common CRM e-Business Entities in Relationship with Customers CRM Terminology Siebel CRM – “The Good CRM System” Top Ten Siebel CRM Myths Siebel CRM On-Demand – The Complete Solution

3. CRM Definitions CRM (Customer Relationship Management) is a business solution that tracks all communications between a company and its customers. a combination of a business strategy and operations to identify, attract, increase retention, build loyalty and using efficient management during the whole life cycle of each customer.

5. Siebel CRM History The company was founded by Thomas Siebel in 1993. Siebel Systems was named the fastest growing company in the United States in 1999 by Fortune magazine Of late 2000 the company had more than 700 alliance partners . On September 12, 2005, Oracle Corporation bought Siebel Systems for $5.8 billion.

6. Common CRM e-Business Entities in Relationship with Customers Account Lead Opportunity Service request Contact Activity Marketing Campaign

7. SIEBEL CRM – “The Good CRM System”

15. MYTH No 4 HOW TO INTEGRATE?

16. Myth No 4 It has standard web service interface for integration with external systems. Siebel CRM multi-layer architecture: User Interface Object Manager Data Manager - It is between Object Manager and database. Generates real-time SQL. Data Exchange Layer - Separates DLL for each target database.

18. Myth No 5 Database Hardware O/S Browser

19. MYTH No 6 HOW CHALLENGING IS IT TO FIND SIEBEL CRM CONSULTANTS?

20. Siebel consultant characteristics: Strong IT backgroun d CRM business understanding – Sales processes, Marketing Automation, Service, Knowledge management, Call Center, Analytics. Siebel Certification courses Communication skills Myth No 6

21. MYTH No 7 WHAT ABOUT USABILITY AND ACCESSIBILITY?

22. Siebel CRM has more than15 years of history that bring lots of best practices and usability features Key usability and other enhancements to Siebel 8 include: Siebel Task-Based User Interface Change Business Processes in Real Time New and Enhanced Search Capabilities Expanded Web Services Support Advanced Deployment Management Myth No 7

23. MYTH No 8 IS IT GOOD FOR MOBILE DEVICES?

25. MYTH No 9 SIEBEL ANALITYCS = ORACLE ANSWERS ?

26. Myth No 9 BI Suite Enterprise Edition was originally known as Siebel Analytics Actually a company called nQuire developed the technology that eventually became Siebel Analytics T he query and analysis engine and mobile analytics in Oracle's BI suites are based on Siebel technology

27. MYTH No 10 IS SIEBEL CRM ON DEMAND A COMPLETE CRM SOLUTION?

28. Myth No 10 Easy to use , f ast to deploy Data is owned by the company, but stored somewhere else Pay per user, per year No extra expenses for software and hardware CRM infrastructure - All you need is a browser (IE;Mozilla) Use the new version of the CRM software. Expedite and enhance implementation and upgrades Customizations and integrations are limited PROS CONS Internet traffic – scanned, international internet connection. No extra expenses for system and DB administration

29. Siebel CRM On-Demand – Complete CRM
